data.title: Quad Cinema
data.meta_description: Established in 1972, Quad Cinema is New York's original multi-screen cinema.
data.text: Ten auteurs have carte blanche to write and direct works inspired by some of the most beautiful opera pieces ever composed. Theresa Russell stars in regal drag for then-husband Roeg in Verdi’s “Un ballo in maschera;” Bridget Fonda and James Mathers powerfully channel Wagner’s “Liebestod” (from “Tristan and Isolde”) for Roddam; Godard goes to the gym for Lully’s “Armide;” and, in Bryden’s portion, threaded throughout, John Hurt interprets Leoncavallo’s “I pagliacci” as a faded actor.
